backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor implementing a multi-user workout tracking system with exercise library management (add, edit, delete templates with sets/reps), workout session creation and tracking, and workout history retrieval, using Principal-based user isolation and Map data structures.
backend/migration.mo: Migration module that transforms old single-user actor state (flat exercise and session maps) into new multi-user state (Principal-keyed nested maps), currently returning empty maps to reset state during migration.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting three authentication-related features: login page component, conditional Layout rendering for authenticated users, and logout button functionality.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Comprehensive summaries of all frontend source files describing the React application structure, including routing, authentication, exercise management, workout tracking with localStorage persistence, and history viewing components.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom OKLCH color system defining light and dark theme variables, featuring amber/orange accent colors and comprehensive design tokens for UI components.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point for the Track-A-Swole application with root div and module script reference to main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: TanStack Router configuration defining all application routes including login, home, exercise library, session creation, active workout with exerciseIds search param validation, and workout history with detail views.
Form component for creating exercise templates with name input, three sets of weight/reps inputs with validation, comments field, and explicit onClick handler on submit button to ensure proper form submission.
frontend/src/components/CompletedExercis: Read-only card component displaying completed exercise details in a table format with set number, weight, reps, and optional comments section for workout history views.
frontend/src/components/ExerciseListItem: Displays a single exercise template with edit/delete functionality, allowing users to modify exercise name (backend limitation) and view/edit sets and comments with validation and toast notifications.
frontend/src/components/ExercisePicker.t: Dropdown selector component that displays available exercise templates from the library and allows users to add them to a workout session.
Collapsible card component for tracking exercise performance during a workout, with inputs for weight/reps per set and a comments field.
frontend/src/components/HistorySessionCa: Displays a summary card for a completed workout session showing date, name, and exercise count, with navigation to detailed session view.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: Main application layout with header, navigation bar, and authentication handling that redirects unauthenticated users to login and provides logout functionality.
frontend/src/components/SessionExerciseL: Displays a reorderable list of selected exercises for a workout session with controls to move exercises up/down and remove them.
frontend/src/components/SetInputRow.tsx: Simple input row component for entering weight and reps for a single set, with number validation and optional disabled state.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React Query hook that creates and manages the backend actor instance based on Internet Identity authentication state, invalidating dependent queries when identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides React context and hooks for Internet Identity authentication, managing login state, identity persistence, and AuthClient configuration with support for delegation identity validation.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for all backend operations including exercise CRUD, workout session creation, exercise tracking, and history retrieval with automatic cache invalidation.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom CSS variables for light/dark theme color schemes, including primary amber/orange colors and chart color definitions.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that sets up React Query and Internet Identity providers, then renders the root App component.
frontend/src/pages/ActiveWorkout.tsx: Manages active workout sessions with localStorage persistence, allowing users to track exercises with sets/reps/weight, restore interrupted sessions, and complete workouts.
frontend/src/pages/CreateSession.tsx: Provides UI for creating new workout sessions by naming them, selecting exercises from the library, reordering exercises, and navigating to the active workout page.
frontend/src/pages/ExerciseLibrary.tsx: Displays and manages the user's exercise template library with add/edit/delete capabilities through a dialog-based form interface.
frontend/src/pages/Home.tsx: Landing page component displaying welcome message and four navigation cards linking to exercise library, new session creation, workout history, and progress tracking features with amber/orange gradient styling.
frontend/src/pages/Login.tsx: Login page component that handles Internet Identity authentication, displays a branded card with sign-in button, and redirects to home page upon successful authentication.
frontend/src/pages/SessionDetail.tsx: Displays detailed view of a single workout session including name, date, and list of completed exercises with their set data, fetched by session ID from URL params.
frontend/src/pages/WorkoutHistory.tsx: Displays a list of all past workout sessions using HistorySessionCard components, with loading states, error handling, and empty state messaging.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom theme extensions including OKLCH color system, border radius variables, custom animations for accordions, and plugins for typography, container queries, and animations.
project_state.json: Project metadata and architectural documentation defining Track-A-Swole workout tracking app requirements, including exercise library with 3-set templates, session management, history viewing, and Internet Identity authentication integration.
